definition: A condition where the blood pressure in the arteries is consistently elevated, often leading to heart disease, stroke, or kidney problems.
A medication used to treat high blood pressure and chest pain by relaxing blood vessels and improving blood flow.
A group of diseases that affect the body’s ability to produce or respond to insulin, leading to abnormal blood sugar levels.
A chronic condition involving the airways in the lungs becoming inflamed and narrowed, causing difficulty breathing.
Commonly known as a heart attack, it occurs when the blood flow to a part of the heart muscle is blocked.
A medical emergency where there is a sudden disruption of blood supply to the brain, leading to brain damage.
Inflammation of the lining of the bronchial tubes, often caused by infection, leading to coughing and difficulty breathing.
A waxy substance found in the blood, where high levels can increase the risk of heart disease and stroke.
A condition that causes inflammation and stiffness in the joints, often resulting in pain and limited movement.
An infection of the lungs caused by bacteria, viruses, or fungi, leading to symptoms like coughing, fever, and difficulty breathing.
A broad term for diseases where abnormal cells grow uncontrollably, often forming tumors and spreading to other parts of the body.
A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures caused by abnormal electrical activity in the brain.
A progressive neurological disorder that affects movement, often causing tremors, rigidity, and difficulty with coordination.
A progressive condition that causes memory loss, confusion, and changes in behavior due to the degeneration of brain cells.
A virus that attacks the body's immune system, specifically the CD4 cells, making the body more susceptible to infections.
An inflammation of the liver, usually caused by viral infections, leading to symptoms like jaundice, fatigue, and abdominal pain.
A contagious bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs, but can also affect other parts of the body.
A severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light or sound.
Inflammation of the stomach lining, often caused by infection, alcohol use, or certain medications, leading to symptoms like nausea and abdominal pain.
A sore that develops on the lining of the stomach, small intestine, or esophagus, often caused by bacterial infection or the use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs).
Inflammation of the appendix, typically causing pain in the lower right abdomen, nausea, and fever, often requiring surgical removal.
A condition in which the blood has a lower than normal number of red blood cells or hemoglobin, leading to fatigue and weakness.
Scarring of the liver tissue often caused by chronic liver disease or excessive alcohol use, leading to liver dysfunction.
A chronic autoimmune disease where the body's immune system attacks the protective sheath around nerve fibers in the central nervous system.
A condition in which bones become weak and brittle, increasing the risk of fractures, commonly associated with aging.
A contagious bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs but can also affect other parts of the body, causing coughing, chest pain, and weight loss.
A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep, or waking up too early, leading to fatigue and reduced functioning.
A condition where the spine curves sideways, often in an 'S' or 'C' shape, which may cause back pain or affect posture.
An eye condition that damages the optic nerve, often caused by high intraocular pressure, leading to vision loss if untreated.
A chronic autoimmune skin condition that leads to the rapid growth of skin cells, causing scaly, red patches on the skin.
An autoimmune disorder where the immune system attacks the joints, causing pain, swelling, and eventual joint damage.
An autoimmune disorder where ingestion of gluten damages the small intestine, leading to digestive problems and malabsorption of nutrients.
A genetic disorder in which the blood does not clot properly, leading to excessive bleeding after injury or surgery.
A type of cancer that originates in the lymphatic system, often causing swollen lymph nodes, fever, and unexplained weight loss.
A diverse group of blood cancers that include all types of lymphoma except Hodgkin's lymphoma, often affecting the lymph nodes and spleen.
A serious mental disorder characterized by distorted thinking, hallucinations, and a reduced ability to distinguish reality from fantasy.
A mental health condition characterized by extreme mood swings, including emotional highs (mania) and lows (depression).
An eating disorder characterized by an intense fear of gaining weight, leading to restricted food intake and often severe weight loss.
An eating disorder characterized by binge eating followed by purging through vomiting, excessive exercise, or laxative use.
A condition characterized by excessive body fat that may lead to health problems like heart disease, diabetes, and high blood pressure.
A condition where a person hears ringing, buzzing, or other sounds in the ears when no external sound is present.
Inflammation of the sinuses, often caused by infection or allergies, leading to symptoms like facial pain, congestion, and headaches.
A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, swelling, and redness in the joints, usually caused by excess uric acid in the blood.
A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that causes inflammation and irritation in the digestive tract, leading to symptoms like abdominal pain, diarrhea, and weight loss.
A common digestive disorder characterized by symptoms like cramping, bloating, diarrhea, and constipation, with no clear underlying cause.
Hard deposits that form in the gallbladder, which can block the normal flow of bile and cause pain or infection.
A genetic disorder that affects the lungs, pancreas, and other organs, leading to thick mucus that causes breathing problems and digestive issues.
A chronic autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks the body’s own tissues, affecting the skin, joints, kidneys, and other organs.
